text: A new law is being voten on in the Assembly.
choices: By partaking in the vote, you did the right thing. While citizens were not absolutely required to vote in the Assembly, it was considered a civic duty and voting was very encouraged.
You suffered no punishments. However, since only roughly 10% of the population could vote, it was encouraged for all citizens to vote in the Assembly. Source: LibreTexts (Social Science)

text: A metic is being granted access to property by the Assembly.
choices: Supporting the decision is not a bad thing to do, even though in most cases non-citizens could not own property. The Assembly's power allowed it to grant property to people of lower class.

According to Cambridge University, there was a law restricting metics from owning land. You did not make a bad decision, though in Ancient Athens there was an exception: metics could be granted property from the Assembly in rare cases.
